text: Tap at the brewpub. Poured a murky medium brown with a broken off white head. The aroma is malt, spicy red berry fruit. The flavour is moderate sweet with a sweet malt sugary fruit palate and a bubbly mouthfeel. Medium bodied with average carbonation. An interesting take on a weizenbock.

Draught at the brewpub in Prague. Dark amber/brown beer with a nice lasting beige head. Malty fruity aroma, caramel, slightly spicy, raisins, tiny earthy with banana notes. Malty caramel aroma, dark bread, spicy, some raisins, earthy, some banana. Really great well balanced beer.

0,3l from tap at OP, Brno. Black colour, small tan head. Smells of spices, caramel, banana, earthy almost smoky. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Tastes of banana, spices, earthy, caramel, light flourish, some licorice. Finishes lightly dry with notes of banana and spices.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Wheat, banana, sweet, light chocolate.
Appearance: Cloudy dark brown color. All time, light brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light sourish, light chocolate, wheat, light citrusy peel.
Palate: Medium-full body. Light fizzy. Light sticky texture. Light sweet, astringent finish.
Overall: Very nice, tasty, complex.

Bottle. Pours in black body with low off-white head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, candi, nice balance. Taste has light coffee roasty sweetness with earthy carbonation, really drinkable. Body is medium with pretty high carbonation. Very good.

From tap - 0,25l at brewpub. Pours deep dark brown liquid, medium to big frothy tan head, fell down after a while, small layer stayed, Aroma: wheat, yeasty, banana, citrus, clove, minor caramel, quite dominant yeasty/ citrus - perhaps due to the age of the beer (one of the last beers from the last KEG), Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter, medium sour, fruity, citrus, lemon, yeasty, some banana, tastes more like a standard weizen than a dunkel weizen, Palate: light to medium body, slick texture, lively carbonation, long acid fruity finish, Overall: good, certainly near end of shelf like, all the way acceptable, quite drinkable, rather enjoyed.

Draught
Aroma-coriander, ginger, 
Appearance-brown, cloudy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, abrupt finish
Overall-perfect

on tap at the brewpub, february 2013. more of a dunkelweizen than dunkelweizenbock but no need to quibble when its this good. a beautiful very dark brown with a fluffy beige head; aroma of musk and caramelised banana; flavours of creme caramel crust, toffee apple and some wheaty acidity with a touch of burnt grass. very nicely balanced; yet another great beer from strahov

Dark brown color with small head. Aroma of malts, roast, caramel, bananas. Taste is light sweet, light sour, damn good balance. Light body, oily texture, avarage carbonation.  May be the best Czech weizenbock

bottle with thanks to cuso! Cloudy deep dark brown colour, mid-sized, creamy beige head. Aroma of cinnamon and dried fruit. Medium-bodied, caramel-chocolate flavours, dark, roasted malts, fruity background, dried fruit and blackcurrant. Smooth palate.

330 ml bottle. From Cuso. ¡Muchas gracias!
Dark hazy brown colour with average size creamy off-white head.
Dark fruits, malt, raisins, mild alcohol and some tartness. 
Refreshing fruity flavour with mild bitterness, mild tartness and darkish malt.
Very balanced. Quite thin though. Enjoyable.

Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prága (Im not sure about the original czech name of this seasonal beer). Az egyik kedvenc helyem Prágában, zseniálisak. Idén Januárban egy szűretlen barna búzasörrel örvendeztettek meg. Felhős, átláthatatlan narancsbarna színe van és jókora kitartó, krémes-kemény piszkosfehér, bézshez közelítő habja. Illata enyhén pörkölt búzamalátás, banános, halványan csokis és élesztősen száraz. Ízében is a banán, a búzamalátás-rozskenyeres íz, csokis keksz, tej és élesztő finom együttese található meg. Nagyon lágy és mégis tartalmas, összetett ízvilággal rendelkező, egészen testes búzasör. Illik a téli hideghez, de bármikor elfogadnám!

bottle via Cuso in trade...hooray!  Deep dark brown. Single finger beige head.  Steady carbonation. Strong spicy nose with light whispy bananna esters.  Strong baseline of the wonderful wheat yeast strain I enjoyed so much at the brewwery a number of years ago.  Body is light to moderate and does not linger.  Finish is abrubt.  Slippers on and relaxing in the barko lounge chair.  If there was a bit mopre body it would be glorious.

Bottle from brewery. This year, brewery decided to make dark Weizenbock. Dark brown almost black color. Aroma of roasted malt, toffee, caramel, hints of honey. Taste, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, dry bitterness in background. Nice long dry bitter finish. Excellent Weizenbock.

"Three Kings" wheat beer on tap at Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours a hazy orange colour with moderate carbonation and a foamy white head. The nose is citrus fruits (particularly orange), yeasty, wheat and grassy. The taste is orange, sweet tangerine, peach, pineapple and wheat with a pleasant foamy mouth-feel. It is a decent wheat beer which is easy to drink.

On tap at the brewpub. Cloudy orange with a firm and lasting white head. Aroma dominated by spicy phenols, along with plenty banana esters. Dry bready malt flavour with banana and spice. Im not a weizenbock lover, but this is a well crafted beer for sure.
Draught @ Brewpub, Prague. Pours hazy orange with a small creamy white head. Banana, bread and perfume. Flavor is bread , banana and wheat. Sweet and estery. Full bodied. Fine example of the style.
